title: Nuseed U.S. & Canada - Sunflower Harvest Combine Seed Pour

subtasks: Adjusting the tractor's attachments
Connecting the disk harrow to the tractor
Guiding the disk harrow through the field
Ensuring the harrow is set at the correct depth
Starting the tractor engine
Adjusting the speed while navigating fields
Stopping the tractor at appropriate intervals
Setting the harrow blades to desired angle
Monitoring the harrow depth as it works through the soil
Pushing the harrow to till the ground
Navigating the tractor through rows without crops
Ensuring straight path for the harrow operation
Moving the tractor across unplanted areas
Maintaining speed and direction while moving through fields

tasks.task: Checking the Harrow for Proper Tilling
subtasks: Observing the ground after the harrow has passed
Determining if the soil is adequately broken up or not
Applying the brakes to stop the tractor
Turning off the engine and allowing unloading
Disengaging the harrow from the tractor
Manually lowering the harrow to the ground
Removing any attached equipment

tasks.task: Stopping the Tractor and Lowering it
subtasks: Bringing the tractor to a halt
Positioning the tractor on its stand or lowering it to the ground
Checking the harrow's securing mechanism
Making sure it won't shift during transport

tasks.task: Moving the Farm Equipment to the Garage
subtasks: Guiding the tractor back to its storage area
Park the tractor in its designated spot
Ensuring all equipment is neatly stored

tasks.task: Operating a Trailer for Equipment Transport
subtasks: Hitching the trailer to the tractor
Driving the trailer slowly to the garage or shop
Securing the equipment onto the trailer
Brushing off debris from the harrow teeth
Inspecting for any broken or loose components
Opening the oil can or spray bottle
Applying a light coat of oil to moving parts
Tightening any bolts or pins on the harrow
Covering the harrow with a protective tarp or blanket
Detaching the trailer from the tractor
Unloading the trailer if necessary
Securing the trailer in its storage area
Ensuring all farm equipment is properly stowed
Checking bindings or chains securing the load
Turning off the tractor's engine
Allowing the engine to cool down
Connecting the fuel hose to the equipment's tank
Monitoring the fuel level until it is full
Removing the tarp from the harrow
Positioning the tarp neatly for reuse
Aligning the disk harrow coulter with the tractor's hitch Point
Securing the coulter to the tractor for traction
Walking the tractor from the barn to the house
Unlocking the door and entering the home
Putting away any tools or gear used during the day
Hanging clothes or accessories in designated areas

tasks.task: Operating a Disk Harrow, there could be a subtask about setting the angle and depth. Then driving the tractor, which includes starting, adjusting speed, and stopping. So the main activities are driving the tractor, operating the harrow, unloading and storing the equipment, and cleaning.
Checking the Harrow for Proper Tilling
Stopping the Tractor and Lowering it
Moving the Farm Equipment to the Garage
Operating a Trailer for Equipment Transport

Checking the Harrow for Proper Tilling. Are there any other checks they might perform? The example video might not show, but perhaps they check for uneven tilling, make sure the teeth aren't clogged. So maybe as part of checking the harrow, those could be subtasks.
Operating a Trailer. So ensuring proper coupling, driving slowly to the garage, checking load security.
Operating a Trailer. Subtasks like hitching the trailer, driving it safely, unloading, and checking security.
Lastly, returning to the house and storing personal effects. Maybe just putting away tools. So that's a separate MAINTASK.
